alert.note: Alert for Chattooga (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 5:01PM EST until February 24 at 1:36PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Chattooga River near Summerville affecting Chattooga County. For the Chattooga River...including Summerville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to begin late this afternoon. * WHERE...Chattooga River near Summerville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Between 12 and 14 feet, Bankfull conditions are reached along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 27 or Rome Boulevard. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 15 feet just after midnight tonight. It is forecasted to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 14 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.2 feet on 04/01/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
